tool.name: Extract SNP Region
tool.description: Extract flanking SNP region from Genbank file

param.name: snp_positions
param.label: File with predicted SNP positions (SNP Panel)

param.name: flanking_bases
param.label: Number of bases on *each side* of the SNP positions in ref genome. Default is 20

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
Extracts a snp position from a given SNP panel file from a coorespinding genbank file, flanked on both sides by nucleotides of the given flanking base.
------
.. class:: infomark
**Example SNP Panel**
Here's an example of what a tab delimited SNP panel file looks like::
AE003852.1 53458 AE003852.1 53471 AE003852.1 53506 AE003852.1 53521
The first column is the molecule name as referenced in the genbank file. The second column is the SNP position.
------
.. class:: infomark
**Tool Author**
Mando Rodriguez
------
.. class:: infomark
**Tool Help and Usage**
::
usage: extract_snp_regions.py [-h] [-f FLANKING_BASES] -s SNP_POSITIONS -g REF_GENBANK [-o OUTPUT_FILE]
optional arguments: -h, --help show this help message and exit -f FLANKING_BASES, --flanking_bases FLANKING_BASES Number of bases on *each side* of the SNP positions in the reference genome. Default is 20. -s SNP_POSITIONS, --snp_positions SNP_POSITIONS snp panel file -g REF_GENBANK, --ref_genbank REF_GENBANK genbank annotation file -o OUTPUT_FILE, --output_file OUTPUT_FILE output file
